title: sans serif font
content:
are these two text images any different in terms of typography or do they have the same font? if so, can anyone identify the type? thanks much!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110302im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_4514.jpg)
  
Exhibit 1

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110302im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font2_4372.jpg)
  
Exhibit 2
 [‹ holsten beer logo font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110302/http:/typophile.com/node/50243 "Go to previous forum topic") [Fancy script ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110302/http:/typophile.com/node/50221 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fidelpmn2n

comments.content:
Probably the medium or bold weights:

[http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff\_din\_medium/?sample\_tex...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110302/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_din_medium/?sample_text=OPENING%20DATE%3A%20OCTOBER%2024%2C%202008&sample_size=24 "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff\_din\_medium/?sample\_text=OPENING%20DATE%3A%20OCTOBER%2024%2C%202008&sample\_size=24")

The first one isn’t [FF DIN](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110302/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FF%252BDIN), see the ‘C’. Maybe it’s Parachute’s DIN Text or another [‘Me Too’ DIN](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110302/http:/www.emigre.com/Editorial.php?sect=2).
